name: unaudited
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of the accounts of a business) not having been officially checked : The company's unaudited accounts show net liabilities of £340,851 as at 31 January. Companies have to submit audited or unaudited quarterly financial results within 45 days of every quarter.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company has reported an increase in turnover of 41 percent in its unaudited results for the year ending 31 May.If audited financial statements are not available, the customer should provide unaudited statements.The interim financial statements are always unaudited.

Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe accounts or the amounts in them that have not been approved by outside accountants: unaudited figures/numbers/accounts According to unaudited figures, we ended the year with a surplus of $1.1 million. The company will release unaudited financial statements for the past three years by Aug 31. Each fiscal year, you will receive an audited annual report and an unaudited semi-annual report.
